text: Jack Guittet (12 January 1930 – 16 January 2025) was a French fencer. He won a bronze medal in the team épée event at the 1964 Summer Olympics. He also competed at the 1959 Mediterranean Games where he won gold medals. Guittet was born in Casablanca, Morocco. Guittet died on 16 January 2025 in Mignaloux- Beauvoir, France at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for France Category:French fencers Category:People from Casablanca
title: Jack Guittet
